abstract: Experts tend to underestimate the likelihood that their predictions might be wrong.
snippet: Experts tend to underestimate the likelihood that their predictions might be wrong.
lead_paragraph: The post I put up early Thursday morning on Herman Cain prompted its share of annoyed reactions from some of the journalists and analysts whose work I admire. This is to be expected, since the article was essentially a critique of expert judgment.

headline.main: Herman Cain and the Hubris of Experts
